DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator related to signs and symptoms of blockage of passageway of the stomach and intestines.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to signs and symptoms of blockage of passageway of the stomach and intestines.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.:Blockage of a passageway.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have clinica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinical symptoms or signs of gastrointestinal obstruction and require parenteral hydration and/or nutrition

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptoms of partial or complete bowel obstruction or a history of fistula, intra-abdominal abscess or bowel perforation within 6 months prior to first day of study therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula or anastomotic leak, gastrointestinal perforation or intra-abdominal abscess within 6 months of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require drainage gastrostomy (e.g., PEG tube) and/or parenteral hydration and/or nutrition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation or intra-abdominal abscess within 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have PEG tube placement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require parenteral hydration or nutrition AND have evidence of partial bowel obstruction or perforation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require parental hydration and/or nutrition

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have current signs/symptoms of bowel obstruction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinical or radiographic evidence of bowel obstruction?

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Symptom Ind-3  2018861v1.0 with VD ID#3506034 - Yes No Unknown Indicator  - dbw
